DataElement.preferredName: Person Receive Radiation Therapy Prior Protocol Agent Initiation Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A response to determine patient eligibility for clinical trial participation for questions related to the receipt of radiation therapy prior to the start of an investigational agent as outlined in the study protocol.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Person Receive Radiation Therapy Prior Protocol Agent Initiation Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A human being._To take, accept, or get something offered._Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation._Earlier in time or order._A medical product, practice, or application that is tested in a clinical trial._The act of starting something; an act that sets in motion some course of events._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Property.preferredName: Receive Radiation Therapy Prior Protocol Agent Initiation Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: To take, accept, or get something offered.:Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.:Earlier in time or order.:A medical product, practice, or application that is tested in a clinical trial.:The act of starting something; an act that sets in motion some course of events.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: To take, accept, or get something offered.

Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.
A medical product, practice, or application that is tested in a clinical trial.
The act of starting something; an act that sets in motion some course of events.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: If patient has received minim
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has received minimal radiation therapy (less than or equal to 5% of their total marrow volume) was it more than or equal to 3 weeks prior to the initiation of study treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received radiation therapy within 2 weeks prior to C1D1?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has received radiation to bone metastases, have at least 2 weeks elapsed prior to initiation of treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has received radiation therapy targeting more than 10% of the bone marrow space, was radiation completed at least 2 weeks prior to starting therapy with KRT-232 (AMG 232) + KRd?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received radiation to more than 25% of the bone marrow?
